72097.name: Brennan's ExBEARdition
72097.description:
Based on part of the Brennan Bear Series games and books.
Brennan's ExBEARdition is designed to help your student's listening skills grow through thinking and discussion. Students will have fun as they practice listening skills in basic concepts, vocabulary, and language.

Players will answer questions, roll the die, and move along the game board to collect 4 different souvenir picture cards- one from each of the Brennan's destinations (Kool Kat's, Tiffany's, Tweet's, and the Milky Way). The first student or team to collect the 4 different souvenir picture cards wins the game.

Each Stimulus card contains questions for the young and advanced. Questions are based on- basic concepts, vocabulary, and language- with 15 listening cards for an All Play activity.

72099.name: Grandia III
72099.description:
"Set in a fantasy world where technology has allowed man to fly in magic-powered aircraft, a boy named Yuki is determined to become a great pilot like his idol, the Sky Captain Schmidt. When he and his mother encounter a girl named Alfina who has the ability to communicate with the spiritual guardians of the world, they become involved in the plot to discover the secrets of the world's past and face an evil rogue guardian named Xorn. "

Source: Wikipedia, "Grandia_3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72100.name: Makai Kingdom: Chronicles of the Sacred Tome
72100.description:
"The story's protagonist is a self-proclaimed "Bad-ass Freakin' Overlord" named Lord Zetta, who attempts to prevent the destruction of his netherworld prophesized by Pram the Oracle. After discovering the Sacred Tome, Zetta finds a passage claiming that his own stupidity would be the downfall of his Netherworld. Infuriated, he burns the book, only to remember immediately afterwards that destroying the book would destroy his world. He quickly responds by confining his soul to the Sacred Tome and ventures to rewrite his world into existence by having the other Overlords of Netherworlds write wishes within his pages."

Source: Wikipedia, "Makai_Kingdom," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72101.name: Encyklopedia Digoni
72101.description:
Back of the book (in Swedish):

Encyklopedia Digoni tränger djupt in i Khelataars mystiska värld och berättar om alla de olika kulturer och legender som finns på Khelataar. Du kan läsa en mycket ingående beskrivning av KhelinnOrdern och Vishetens sällskap. Du får också ta del av den färgstarka heraldiken i Khelataar.

Nattens ögon, det gömda broderskapet med sina krigare som strider i skydd av skuggorna, beskrivs i detalj.

Nya magicirklar och formler finns för den magikunnige.

Zoologikapitlet innehåller allt från den minsta lilla trädklättrare till de mest fasansfulla av de legendariska monstren. Förutom illustrationer och ritningar kan du även hitta regler för hur de olika urinvånarna används som rollpersoner.

User translation:

Encyklopedia Digoni delves deep into the mystic world of Khelataar and tells about the various cultures and legends in Khelataar. You can read a very detailed description of the KhelinnOrder and Vishetens sällskap (Society of the Wise). You will also learn about the colourful heraldry in Khelataar.

Nattens ögon (Eyes of the Night), the forgotten brotherhood with its warriors that fight under cover of the night, is described in detail.

New magic circles and spells are provided for the magic-knowledgeable.

The zoology chapter contains everything from the smallest tree-climber to the most fearsome of the legendary monsters. Apart from illustrations and maps you will also find rules for how the different natives can be used as player characters.

72107.description:
User Summary:

Although it's the 18th title of the series it is by far not the best. The graphics is okay I guess, but that's really about all. User interface has so many errors that the game loses it's charm. For example - when you pass the ball to another player, he will in most cases imediately return the ball to you, since the same "button" means "pass" and "call for the ball". So instead of receiving the ball and moving forward or passing onwards, he returns the ball back to you - if you're lucky enough it doesn't get stolen before it reaches you. It also lags like it was running on a computer for middle age - when you get close to the goal and press to shoot it takes about two second before your player actually kicks the ball and in most cases the goalkeeper will by then throw himself on the ball and all you can do is cry. By then you will probably lose the will to play another match.

72108.description:
"Outcast is an action-adventure computer game by Belgian developer Appeal, released in 1999 by publisher Infogrames. It was named the "Adventure Game of the Year" by GameSpot the same year.

Plot:

In 2007 the U.S. government successfully sends a probe to an alien world in a parallel universe. The probe starts transmitting video images of the world back to Earth. Then, just minutes into the mission, an alien life form discovers the probe and damages it, causing an unforeseen backlash of energy to create a black hole threatening Earth. Cutter Slade, a former U.S. Navy SEAL, is given the job of escorting three scientists (William Kauffmann, Anthony Xue and Marion Wolfe) on a mission to this alien world to recover the probe and close the black hole.

Arriving in this alien world, Cutter is separated from the other scientists and is hailed by the natives as their messiah, the Ulukai."

Source: Wikipedia, "Outcast_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72109.description:
"Company of Heroes is a real-time strategy computer game developed by Relic Entertainment. It was released on September 12, 2006, and was the first title to make use of the Games for Windows label. A standalone expansion, Opposing Fronts, was released on September 25, 2007. A second standalone expansion, Tales of Valor was released in April 2009. The game was released as a free-to-play download in South Korea in April 2010.

Company of Heroes is set during World War II. In the single-player campaign the player commands two U.S. military units during the Battle of Normandy and the Allied capture of France. Depending on the mission, the player controls either Able Company of the 29th Infantry Division or Fox Company of the 101st Airborne's 506th PIR."

Source: Wikipedia, "Company_of_Heroes," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

"2995...mankind tries to recover from cultural amnesia due to centuries of Fentom domination. Mankind, under the protection of the Republic, has a new ambition: the search for its own past, for its own history. At the same time the galaxy is convulsed by an array of alien conflicts, each species searching for their place in a complex political milieu.
In 2995, despite new technologies, where tachyon sensors and cybernetic implants are commonplace, and space travel is limited only by the Milky Way itself, danger lurks in each new star, each new planet, each new city

72113.description:
Fancy Nancy themed game. Players take turns Spinning the spinner to collect at least three different flavors of ice cream in their dish then top it off with a cherry. The spinner has the 4 different ice cream flavors spots, two cherry spots, an Oops! spot, and a Switch a Scoop spot.
Players begin with an empty dish. Play begins with the person wearing pink hearts or the youngest. The player spins the spinner, if it lands on a flavor they do not have they get to put that flavor on their dish, if they already have that flavor, play goes to next player, an Oops! the player must put an ice cream back, a Switch a Scoop lets the player switch a scoop with another player, a cherry lets the player pick a flavor they wish or to put a cherry on their dish if they have 3 different ice cream flavors. The goal is to be the first to have a complete parfait.
Recommended for 2-4 players age 4 and up.
Helps teach turn taking, color recognition and very simple strategy to block another player with the Switch a Scoop. No reading is needed.
Contents:
Spinner
20 scoops of ice cream (cardboard)
4 cherries (cardboard)
4 fancy parfait dishes (cardboard)
1 play mat
-user submitted

"Tagmar
A medieval adventures game
"Since uncountable ages, when the gods created the world of Tagmar, wars scourge the earth. It`s in this scenario that adventurers use swords and magic to confront supernatural creatures and constant threats. These are the heroes that forge their legends by fire and iron..."
In this game with rules in the Role playing games style, the participants control and interpret the actions of adventurers in Tagmar. This genre also know as RPG has great acceptance in the whole world , reaching now to Brasil through Tagmar."

72118.name: Dimension X
72118.description:
Chess in the Twilight Zone. From the introduction:

"This game consists of two parallel planes of existence. On one plane we have a typical chessboard; on the other plane (Dimension X) we have a board inhabited by strange trans-dimensional chess pieces in the form of snakes, spiders and crabs. These creatures can leave Dimension X, and also return
to it..."

The rules of the game are simple. The goal is to checkmate your opponent's king. You start with 2 chess boards next to each other. On one board, you play a normal chess game, making 1 move per turn. On the other board each player has 3 short range pieces - creatures with strange powers - that may only move in Dimension X and only attack in our dimension. Each player, during his or her turn, also either moves one of the Dimension X creatures on the second board, crosses between dimensions, or attacks with a creature in our dimension.

This is a most unusual 3D chess variant that quite literally adds a whole other level of tactics and strategy to chess, with a twist.

72119.name: Crazy Comets
72119.description:
User summary

Crazy Comets is a 1985 Commodore 64 game written by Simon Nicol and published by Martech. The game is a still-screen shoot'em-up, where the player controls a space craft and must shoot down all enemies that enter the screen, stage after stage.

Although the gameplay is 2D, the screen simulates a three-dimensional view, and the spaceship is actually pointing into the screen. Enemies often first appear as small dots, slowly growing larger, and cannot hurt the ship until they have come close enough. They can, however, be shot down.

Typical to Crazy Comets are the obstacles with a "homing missile" movement, and much of the game play consists of dodging these homing dangers all the while shooting them down.

Individual credits:
Simon Nicol: Design, program
Rob Hubbard: Music (C64)

72120.name: Resonance of Fate
72120.description:
From the back cover
"Gorgeous cinematics. Blazing gun battles. RPG is redefined.
From renowned RPG developers tri-Ace comes a danger-filled journey into Basel, a post apocalyptic, steampunk-style machine world. Come out with guns blasting in explosive, acrobatic gun battles as you uncover dark secrets and discover your true fate."

72121.name: Mega-Apocalypse
72121.description:
User summary:

Mega-Apocalypse is a 1987 Commodore 64 game written by Simon Nicol and published by Martech, and is the sequel to "Crazy Comets". It plays very much the same, but it features for 2 players simultaneous play and improved code.

Like Crazy Comets, is is a 2D shooting game, simulating a 3D perspective, with a starry sky in the background where starts appear from the middle of the screen, slowly travelling towards the screens edges, creating an illusion of going into the screen. Enemies (planets) first appear as small dots slowly growing larger, and the goal is to shoot all planets down. Once a planet has come close to the screen, it becomes a real nuisance, since it will withstand a large number of hits and will also home in on the spacecraft the player is controlling.

Unlike Crazy Comets, Mega Apocalypse allows for players to adjust how their ships are pointing. By holding down the fire button, players can point their ships in any direction, and it will retain that direction even when the button is released.

The C64 edition featured music by Rob Hubbard, mostly a remake of the original tune from Crazy Comets. The game was subsequently ported to the Amstrad and the ZX Spectrum.

Individual credits:
Simon Nicol: creator (C64)
Rob Hubbard: music (C64)

72122.name: Colony
72122.description:
"Colony is an arcade adventure and strategy computer game released in 1987 for several 8-bit computer formats by Mastertronic on their Bulldog label.

Owing to overpopulation, humanity has found it necessary to grow food in colonies on other planets. Unfortunately, the mushroom-growing planet that the player is responsible for is also inhabited by hostile native aliens which resemble giant insects. The player must use the droid under their control to maintain and harvest the mushrooms as well as look after and protect the colony itself.

Gameplay takes place in a flick-screen environment consisting of the colony itself (which is made-up of storehouses, some specialist buildings, mushroom fields and areas for solar panels) and the surrounding desert of the alien planet which is filled with various giant insects.
Colony is quite a complicated game and there are numourous things that the player must look-after."

Source: Wikipedia, "Colony_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72123.name: Captain Blood
72123.description:
User summary, some information details from Wikipedia:

Captain Blood (L’Arche du capitaine Blood in French) is a French video game for the Atari ST from 1988 made by ERE Informatique (soon relabeled with their short-lived Exxos label) and released by Infogrames. It was later re-released in the UK by Players Premier Software.

The gameplay is rather unique: The player controls a lone space captain supposed to find and destroy the last five of his own clones, and to do so, he must make contact with aliens living on other planets and communicate with them, making them reveal the coordinates for the next planet to go to. Having reached a planet, the player must steer a landing probe over a fractal landscape trying to reach the alien. Once having reached the alien, the game changes into a strange chat session. As the aliens all speak different languages, the player's ship is equipped with a function that translates all speech into a simplified symbol-based text language. The player must thus chat with the aliens, using these symbols, to gain their trust and have them reveal what they know, and especially reveal coordinates for a new planet to go to.

The title tune is a stripped down version of "Ethnicolor" by Jean Michel Jarre.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain_Blood_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Didier Bouchon: design
philippe Ulrich: design
Jean-Michel Jarre: Composer (Amiga)

72124.name: Citadel (Commodore 64)
72124.description:
Not to be confused with the BBC Micro adventure game Citadel (BBC Micro) by Superior Software (UK).

User summary:

Citadels is a science-fiction themed puzzle game for the Commodore 64, programmed and composed by Martin Walker and published by Electric Dreams.

The game is played on a top-view square-gridded scrolling environment. The player controls a hover craft and the goal is to find the way out. Each stage has a number of power switches that will open or close doors, teleports that will transport the hover craft, and among the obstacles there are turrets that will fire and destroy the hovercraft if it comes within a certain range and direction; some turrets fire only diagonally, while some fire orthogonally. The hovercraft can also equip several types of weapons to be able to destroy these turrets prior to passing them.

Despite the arcade-feel of the game, it is in practice turn-based, as very few enemies will make a move unless the player moves, thus the game is a tactical puzzle/maze game.

The game is a fairly late C64 game and the graphics are astounding for the platform.

Individual credits:
Martin Walker: Program, graphics, music

72125.description:
The galaxy has been a peaceful place for many years. After the ruthless Terran–Hegemony War (30.027–33.364), much effort has been employed by all major spacefaring species to prevent the terrifying events from repeating themselves. The Galactic Council was formed to enforce precious peace, and it has taken many courageous efforts to prevent the escalation of malicious acts. Nevertheless, tension and discord are growing among the seven major species and in the Council itself. Old alliances are shattering, and hasty diplomatic treaties are made in secrecy. A confrontation of the superpowers seems inevitable – only the outcome of the galactic conflict remains to be seen. Which faction will emerge victorious and lead the galaxy under its rule?

A game of Eclipse places you in control of a vast interstellar civilization, competing for success with its rivals. You will explore new star systems, research technologies, and build spaceships with which to wage war. There are many potential paths to victory, so you need to plan your strategy according to the strengths and weaknesses of your species, while paying attention to the other civilizations' endeavors.

The shadows of the great civilizations are about to eclipse the galaxy. Lead your people to victory!

72126.description:
Publisher Blurb:


It's March 1954. The Investigators are sailors and scientists deployed aboard the USS Bairoko to the South Pacific as part of Joint Task Force One to participate in a series of secret thermonuclear test shots in the Bikini atoll called Operation Castle. After the first detonation, the PCs will have more than just radiation to fear...


Castle Bravo is a stand-alone Purist Trail of Cthulhu adventure set in the Atomic Age.

72128.name: Pizza To Go: The Pizza Pickin' Card Game
72128.description: User summary: In each round of this card game, players simultaneously try to collect a set of four matching pizza-topping cards. Players start with four cards in their hand. The dealer takes a new card and discards any unwanted card from his hand to the player to his or her left. That player then discards to the left and play continues (the dealer continuing to pick up and discard) with the last player forming a discard pile in front of them. When a player collects a set of four, that player grabs a pizza box from the center of the table. There is always one fewer pizza boxes than there are players, so each round eliminates one player. Last player standing wins.

72129.name: Robin Hood
72129.description:
1970 Robin Hood boardgame by Editrice Giochi. The game included a 3d representation of the Sherwood Forest, along with a part of the Nottingham castle.

Players have to actually shoot the Nottingham Sheriff figure which walks through the forest. Four small firing crossbows are included in the game.

The game was marketed by Editrice Giochi as a "3Dimensional Game", because of the Sherwood forest setting which has actually to be built before playing.

72130.name: NFL Blitz '99
72130.description:
[User Summary]

NFL Blitz '99 is the second game in the NFL Blitz series. It was released exclusively in arcades and increased the player count from two to four and boasted many new plays. The game was updated with the 1998 NFL rosters.

72131.description:
The game theme is the Portuguese Discoveries in the 15th and 16th century, and their contribution to Portuguese wealth, symbolized in the Jerónimos Monastery. It is an historic fact that the spices trade, brought by the Caravelles, had to pay a tax of 5% in Lisbon, and this tax was used to pay for the monastery construction.

The goal is to achieve the highest possible number of victory points (VPs). The game ends when the last piece of Jeronimos is bought by any player.

The boardgame is the world map with 32 ports / destinations marked around the world (Americas, Africa, Asia and Indic Islands). In 8 of them you can collect the respective merchandise from that port. The board has also marked the real sea currents that the Caravelles followed at the time. It is surprising that often the fastest way is not the shortest, and the game reveals that perfectly.

Each player has a card representing 3 ships, and indicating the player's ability to travel (translated into 9 navigation discs) and the cargo capacity (translated into 6 different merchandise spaces).

The players place their wood ship piece in the board in Lisbon and start navigating. If they follow the sea currents marked in the board, they can do it "free of charge" and endlessly. But they wouldn't go very far. Every time a player wants to go in a different direction than the one indicated by the sea current, he has to use a navigation disc from his player card. When all the navigation discs are used, the player turn stops. So, in each turn, a player can go against the currents at most 9 times, thus determining how far he can go.

During navigation, players arrive in ports. If they are the first to get there, that is, if they are the ones that discover that local, they can place their coloured marker in that port and register the number of VPs marked for that port. If the port is a "trade port" (there are 8), the player can also collect the respective merchandise and place it in his player card.

But there are also some possible surprises. When navigate, players can pass by special marked cells which force them some kind of effect:

- "Event" cells: for each round, players have 5 "Event" cards in their hand; when they pass over these cells, they must choose a card from their hand. These cards can be of 3 types: "Storm Card", "Dead Calm Sea Cards" and "Good Wind Cards", thus having negative or positive effects in their navigation. But they also have an effect on other players, but for these the effect is always positive. This creates interest during players downtime.
- "Pirate Cells": when passing over these cells, players lose immediately 1 of their navigation discs. they can only enter the cell if they have the necessary disc available to pay.
- "Sinking Cells": when passing over these cells, players must take their chance with a 50/50 dice - worse can happen is they lose 1 of the 3 ships they have (or 4 - see below), and the corresponding cargo space. They will only get it back when they arrive in Lisbon.

After some time of navigation, of discovering new ports and collecting one each of the possible 6 merchandises that his player card can carry, the player returns to Lisbon.

In Lisbon the player can:
- trade merchandises per VPs (5 each)
- specifically, the merchandise "pepper" can be traded for 1 piece of the Jeronimos Monastery which worths 10 VPs, which are immediately registered
- the player can also trade 15 VPs for a 4th ship - this 4th ship gives him 3 more navigation discs (increasing it's navigation autonomy from 9 to 12) and 2 more merchandise space cargo.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a number of Objective Cards with specific Ports. If they are the first player to get to that port, they will receive 5 extra VPs per each at the end of the game. These VPs can be decisive in the victory decision.
72131.name: Caravelas

72132.description:
Dragon Rampage, a competitive fantasy game by Richard Launius, is a strategic dice game for 3 to 5 players. Each player takes the role of one of the adventurers (all with different abilities) and the goal is to score the most points at the end of the game by fighting against or running from (or some combination of the two) the dragon you just woke up, and tallying up the treasure and gold you obtain in the dungeon. Players roll seven specially designed dice and choose whether to focus on grabbing treasure (from the dragon or from another player), fighting the dragon, protecting themselves (and their treasure), or running for the exit. Try not to draw the dragon's attention as you make your way, and note that your fellow adventurers may hinder (or aid) you in your strategy and the final scoring varies depending on how the game ends, so watch your step!

The contents of Dragon Rampage is:

1 rulebook

1 game board
6 character mats

30 hero wound tokens (red crystals)
1 first player token
1 re-roll token
8 dice

72 dragon wound cubes (12 per player)
54 hero action tokens (9 per player)
6 player movement tokens (1 per player)

128 cards:

24 dragon rampage cards
32 treasure cards
72 hero character cards (12 per hero)




50 coin tokens:

20 5-value coins
30 1-value coins
72132.name: Dragon Rampage
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 22 – Matt Wolfe and Pooping Wombats | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 30 - Bob and Richard and Drizzt and Michael
Exploring Games, Episode 12: My Top 11 (or more) Favorite Game Mechanics
Game Gab: Gen Con 2011: Keith Blume: Gryphon/Eagle Games
Game Gab: Gen Con 2011: Richard Launius
The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Eagle/Gryphon Games

72134.name: Peter the Great: Warpspawn card game
72134.description: Players bid on cards representing various events during the reign of Peter the Great. Successful bids capture cards which generate victory points symbolizing accomplishments in the modernization of Imperial Russia. Cards with Peter himself don't generate victory points, but rather grant advantageous contingencies. There are 10 cards in each of 7 suites, unlike most Warpspawn card games there aren't different "force" or "power" levels for different cards. The bidding requires different colored cubes picked at random, a unique mechanism in which high bid is most-cubes-of-that-color rather than most-play-money.

72135.name: Lords of Men
72135.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The undisputed rulers of Mythic Europe are the nobility - those high-born who are bound together by sacred vows of loyalty, are supported by the land, and provide support to the Church. Lesser nobles compete for the favor of those superior to them, while great nobles seek the loyalty of those beneath them. When not distracted by the politics of landholding and of war, they hunt the mundane and magical beasts of the forests and host extravagant feasts. For the nobles of Mythic Europe are first and foremost knights in shining armor.

This book contains complete rules and background for the nobility of Mythic Europe, ranging from the details of their lands to their entertainments, political struggles, and dealings with the Order of Hermes. And, of course, it presents special rules for combat, whether at a tournament or during a desperate siege. It also describes the hard lives of the peasants, who make the rich existence of the nobility possible by providing the food at their feasts, the labor for their buildings, and the soldiers in their armies.

72136.name: Kingdoms of Legend: World Guide
72136.description:
(from the back cover)

The World as it Wasn’t
Kingdoms of Legend is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible campaign setting based on an alternate history Earth of the early 15th century. Human empires dominate the landscape while the elves, dwarves, and gnomes struggle to hold on to ancestral homelands. The Greek gods are real: known by various names in different locales. Piracy, war, political intrigue, and danger are commonplace. Heroes are desperately needed in all corners of the globe!

The Kingdoms of Legend: World Guide contains an overview of the setting, introducing 41 different countries in Europe. Also included are two new half-races, new feats, numerous languages, and more!







Pathfinder and associated marks and logos are trademarks of Paizo Publishing, LLC, and are used under license. See paizo.com/pathfinderRPG for more information on the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

72137.name: Silent Hill
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
PSOne Books (Best Selling PSOne Games, JP)
72137.description:
"In 1986, Harry Mason and his daughter, Cheryl, were driving to the resort town of Silent Hill for a vacation, when Harry swerves to avoid a figure in the road. Regaining consciousness after the crash to find Cheryl missing, he sets off in search of her on the streets of Silent Hill, which are deserted, foggy, and where snow is falling out of season.

The goal of the game is to safely guide the player character, Harry Mason, through the dilapidated town of Silent Hill in search of his lost daughter, Cheryl. A major threat to Harry's survival are the hostile creatures wandering along the streets and inside buildings, and poor visibility means that Harry will almost always be surrounded by thick fog or darkness. The player will locate a pocket-size flashlight early in the game, but the light beam only illuminates for a few feet. For this reason, sound plays a large role in Silent Hill' gameplay, as the player will often be alerted to the noises enemies make, rather than the actual sight of them. As well as the flashlight, the player will also pick up a radio, which alerts Harry to the presence of creatures by emitting static when they are in proximity, allowing him to detect monsters before they can ambush him. Another obstacle to Harry's success is his own fragility; being an ordinary man with minimal experience in handling weapons, he cannot sustain many blows from enemies, and will gasp for breath when he has sprinted for a large distance."

Source: Wikipedia, "Silent_Hill_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72138.name: Kingdoms of Legend: The Hidden Threat
72138.description:
(from the back cover)

Danger Lurks Below Turnberry Castle!
A group of novice adventurers responds to the desperate call of the castle steward. A wild animal is loose beneath the keep just as the lord of Turnberry is set to return for the winter. The embarrassing situation needs to be dealt with and quickly!
The heroes soon find there is more to this situation than first meets the eye. Drawn into the midst of a conspiracy, the PCs must fight to neutralize a threat to the safety of the entire castle.

The Hidden Threat is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Compatible adventure for four 1st level heroes set in the Kingdoms of Legend campaign setting.







Pathfinder and associated marks and logos are trademarks of Paizo Publishing, LLC, and are used under license. See paizo.com/pathfinderRPG for more information on the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

72139.name: Silent Hill 2
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
72139.description:
"Silent Hill 2 is a survival horror videogame for Sony PlayStation 2 developed by Team Silent and published by Konami. It is the second installment in the Silent Hill series and although it is set in the series' namesake town, it is not a direct sequel to the events and characters of the first Silent Hill game. Instead, it features James Sunderland, who enters the town after receiving a letter written by his deceased wife, saying she is waiting for him in their "special place" in Silent Hill"

Source: Wikipedia, "Silent_Hill_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72140.name: Wing Commander: The Secret Missions
72140.description:
"Wing Commander: Secret Missions was an add-on campaign from Origin. It requires the WC1 software to run, but adds new missions, new ships, a new storyline, and an increase in difficulty. The game was also released for the Super NES as a stand-alone cartridge.

The Tiger's Claw, on maneuvers in the Goddard System, receives an abortive distress call from Goddard colony. When the Claw arrives, though, nothing is left but wreckage and corpses; a quarter of a million colonists have been killed. Confed realizes that this is the work of a new Kilrathi weapon, the "Graviton weapon," which is able to increase the power of gravity by over a hundred times. Clever work by the Claw's crew and pilots allows them to capture a Kilrathi courier ship, which reveals that this weapon is mounted on an entirely new class of ship; C-in-C codenames it the Sivar-class dreadnought, after the Kilrathi god of war. Bluehair leads the strike against the Sivar and destroys it in the Vigrid system; for unexplained reasons, ships of that class and armament are never seen again.

Unlike the original game, The Secret Missions does not feature a branching mission tree; every player plays the same missions in the same order. However, if the player does not the fulfill the mission requirements at any system, he immediately plays the two losing "retreat" missions that are not on the winning path."

Source: Wikipedia, "Wing_Commander_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72141.name: Wing Commander: The Secret Missions 2: Crusade
72141.description:
"The second expansion pack for Wing Commander, The Secret Missions 2 adds a new narrative, new ships, more difficult missions, and two new wingmen.

The Tiger's Claw is in the Firekka System, whose native intelligent lifeforms (the bird-like Firekkans) are negotiating to join the Terran Confederation. Tensions are high, and will only get higher. There is an unusual Kilrathi presence in the area, including their upgraded Dralthi II and ships that have never been seen before: the Hhriss-class heavy fighter and the Snakeir-class heavy carrier."

Source: Wikipedia, "Wing_Commander_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72142.name: Wing Commander II: Special Operations 1
videogameexpansion: Wing Commander II: Vengeance of the Kilrathi
72142.description:
"Establishing immediately that the canonical ending involves Blair destroying the K'tithrak Mang, the newly-promoted Colonel Blair, along with Col. Ralgha "Hobbes" nar Hhallas, is scheduled for a transfer to the "Special Operations" division of Intelligence, under Col. Taggart, who is Chief Field Officer of Intelligence and Special Operations in the Enigma Sector. Their transfers are delayed, however, by increasing Kilrathi presence in the Pembroke System, including the brand-new Gothri-class heavy fighter; even worse, the Rigel Supply Depot is attacked. ...By Confederation ships, which open fire on Blair when he arrives to investigate."

Source: Wikipedia, "Wing_Commander_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72143.name: Wing Commander II: Special Operations 2
videogameexpansion: Wing Commander II: Vengeance of the Kilrathi
72143.description:
"Blair's leave on Akko Base in the Canewdon System is cut short, but he doesn't mind one bit: Zachary "Jazz" Colson, the traitor from Wing Commander 2, has been sentenced to death, and Maverick will be escorting his prison ship. However, a distraction allows the Mandarins, a society of human traitors that Jazz belongs to, to hijack the Bastille and free Jazz. When he returns to the Concordia, Blair discovers that a new squadron has arrived: the Wild Eagles, under command of Major Todd "Maniac" Marshall, flying the experimental Morningstar heavy fighters.

"

Source: Wikipedia, "Wing_Commander_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

72144.name: Rampant: Rules for Live-Action Role Playing
72144.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Twin Crowns Rules Supplement

Are you truly ready to swing a sword or cast a spell ? Take your role-playing off the tabletop and give it some real live action spice with this book!

Comprehensive rules for Live Action role-playing in a fantasy setting
Character creation, life and death
Boffer weapon combat and construction
Arcane, divine, and alchemical magic
Thievery and economy
Fully skill-based system for multi-talented characters
Play an afternoon with a few friends, or plan a whole weekend for hundreds of eager players
Set up a battle ground in your backyard, a fantasy town at a camp, or a haunted forest in a park

72145.name: Future Roleplayer (Issue 2 - Apr/May 1995)
72145.description:
Contents:

•Free Disks Offer: Check out the amazing collection of software and supplements available all for the price of a stamp
•News: TSR emerge on to the PC market with a £10000 prize on offer.
•The Magician: International best selling author Raymond E. Fiest chats to us about writing fantasy fiction, roleplaying and the onset of the computer age.
•Blasphemous Joy: The scintillating short story which spawned the epic Angel War series of electronic novels
•Playing with Yourself: Solo gaming could be one of the significant growth areas for the roleplaying market. Hers's a brief overview of some of the options currently available
•Stocs Fantasy: Something extra for last month's shareware roleplaying game
•Silicon Aids: Fancy writing your own roleplaying utility programs? Here's how to start
•Entering Cyberspace: Roleplaying by e-mail - how to do it best
•The Directory: Fancy getting in touch with a company? Addresses for companies in the UK and abroad
•Reviews: Dungeon Builder,Forgotten Futures, Planescape, World Tamer's Handbook, Ultimate power, sea law, Space Master comp. 2, Night of the vampire & Hail the Heroes

72146.name: Water Rights
72146.description:
User Summary:

The village of TooFar depends on water from the river -- which has suddenly diminished to a trickle. Village elders send the player characters to travel the riverbed in search of water for their people.

Water Rights is the first of two short adventures designed for the Massconfusion 1984 Gamma World competition. It features a mostly scripted sequence of encounters for pre-generated characters.

72147.name: Chimera
72147.description:
"Chimera is an arcade adventure developed by Shahid Ahmad in 1985.

In Chimera, the player walks through an isometric maze of 8 x 8 screens, trying to find out with which item he may disable the obstacles preventing him from the access of further areas of the ship. When the player has disabled the respective obstacles, he may create with his item a warhead and carry that to a blue room. On activation of all four warheads he must reach the green room in order to complete the quest. The player must also look out for his water and food reserves, which run out faster while he carries something resp. while he is in a hot room. Both can be found once in a while in the maze. If the reserves run out or if he tried to disable an obstacle with a wrong item, he died and has lost the game."

Source: Wikipedia, "Chimera_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Shahid Ahmad: design
Rob Hubbard: music (C74)

72148.name: Eilapam
72148.description:
From the frontcover of the book (in Swedish):

Eilapam - Äventyrens stad
Den blomstrande handelsstaden mitt i Khelataar där bergs-, träsk- och skogsfolket lever tillsammans med khelataarerna. I Eilapams sjudande stadsliv finner du mörka gränder fyllda av ondska men också färgstarka värdshus där du kan ta del av alla intriger, hjältemod och äventyr som staden har att erbjuda. Må lyckan stå dig bi...

User translation:

Eilapam - City of Adventure
The blooming trade city in the middle of Khelataar where the mountain people, swamp people and forrest people live together with the Khelataarians. In Eilapam, teeming with activity, you will find dark alleys filled with evil as well as colourful taverns where you can listen to all intrigues, valour and adventure that the city has to offer. May fortune favour you...

72149.name: Mudflat Walker
72149.description:
User summary:

Mudflat Walker is the second of two short adventures designed for the Massconfusion 1984 Gamma World competition.

Terrible mutant beasts which previously kept to their swamp have begun destroying village crops for no apparent reason. The player characters are loaned the few ancient artifacts held by the village for the task of hunting the beasts, or, perhaps, to find another way to protect the food supply.

72150.name: Keep Safe In Traffic
72150.description:
"The game of playing it safe... while walking, bicycling, and driving."

Teaches children to use their eyes before their feet as they move tokens around a street grid. The crossing guard tokens helps the children and the game also teaches kids to avoid talking to strangers.

Situations include crossing at a traffic light, dialing 911, and hitchhiking.

Includes a colorful board with a spinner, kid tokens, car tokens, rules, and a sheet of reflective stickers for children to put on their bikes.

Cardinal Item No. 7000

72151.name: Super Scooper: The Ice Cream Collectin' Card Game
72151.description: User Summary: Very simple pattern game in which players must lay out non-matching scoops-of-ice-cream cards above a cone. Players start with four scoops in hand, a spinner determines how many scoops can be played out of the players hand, players draw back up to four, and play passes to the left. The “melt” position on the spinner requires a player to return an already played scoop, and “steal a scoop” cards let players steal scoops from others. The first player to get five non-matching scoops played on their cone wins.

72152.name: Election City U.S.A.
72152.description:
User summary: When more than three play, the players form teams.

Each card represents a number of electoral votes. To win the card (and get the votes) a player must roll the number on the card on either die or total of both dice. A player who gets the plurality of votes in a state wins the entire state. The player (or team) that gets the plurality of electoral votes has won the game.

72153.description:
Colonial Battlefleet is a game of tactical starship combat.

Take control of a task force of starships from your colony world and lead your fleet to victory or die a horrible death in the cold vacuum of space! Anything from a stealth destroyer to a mighty battleship is yours to command.

Colonial Battlefleet features easy to learn rules and exciting game play with minimal time spent waiting between turns. Shooting and damage resolution is easy and yields plenty of carnage. Best of all, Colonial Battlefleet is not a "luck of the dice" game. Although the rules are very straightforward, the game offers tremendous tactical depth and your command skills will be put to the test! There are no cumbersome or complicated systems to slow down play. All your attention will be focused on outmaneuvering and outwitting your opponent - not trying to remember rules.

The core rules come with a rich background which includes three playable factions. In addition, rules for creating your own factions are provided, and the system will support starship combat from any sci-fi setting. Technology trees allow you to easily tweak the rules to match the style of starship combat from your favorite books, movies, or TV shows.

Features of Colonial Battlefleet include:

-Fast and simple movement, shooting, and damage resolution
-Balanced fighter rules with minimal bookkeeping
-Adaptability to any sci-fi setting
-A robust yet easy to use starship construction system
-More than thirty unique weapons, defenses, and special equipment to outfit your ships
-Eighty hull sizes grouped into five categories from destroyer through battleship for maximum flexibility in creating your own designs
-Ten starship roles like 'Flagship', 'Battleline', or 'Screen' that define each ship's purpose and gives them bonuses that are relevant to that mission.
-Six technology trees for customizing races
-Optional rules for boarding actions, black holes, planets, warp storms, relatavistic distortion, the dangers of simultaneous warp point transit, and more!
-Full color double-sided counter sheets for missiles, asteroids, mines, warp points, planets, black holes, grape shot, and strategic bombardment rounds

The game is available as a PDF download.

Customers with Excel can take advantage of the point-and-click starship construction tool that is included with the files. You can even save your classes and print off entire fleets in mere minutes.
72153.name: Colonial Battlefleet

72154.name: Sneaky Space Spinners
72154.description:
Humanity has made the jump to the stars only to find that they are not alone. We are threatened by pirates, aliens and danger at every turn. Our only hope is to send 2-4 intrepid heroes into the unknown to find new technology that might turn the tide in earth's favor.

Players take on the role of Earth's last hope, charting the galaxy, discovering new worlds and making a profit on the side. Keep an eye out for the four mysterious alien races: The Heartiols, The Diamondias, The Clubstations and The Spadoo. These fantastic beings have harnessed the power to 'spin' their region of space and will impart that power to you, for a price. With this power, the Human race can effectively turn away any invader that might threaten the Earth. Only a hero with all four space spinning artifacts can save us!

Playable with 4 space tiles, player ship tracking boards some tokens and a deck of standard playing cards!

72155.name: Folklore
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
72155.description:
From the back cover
"Adventure Waits on the Other Side...
There exists a village where the living can speak to the dead. Two strangers will find themselves thrown into the wonders and dangers of the Netherworld to discover its secrets.

Cross over and explore 7 incredible spirit realms.
Face over 100 creatures in battle and collect their powers.
Arm yourself with the attacks of your defeated enemies."

72157.name: Dungeon Master for Dummies
72157.description:
From the back of the book:
Sharpen you DM skills, practice storytelling, and get to know your players

Whether you're just considering venturing into the world of the Dungeon Master or you want to hone a fledgling skill, here's the place to start. Not only do our experts give you the full scoop on running and improving a game, creating adventures, crafting plots, and building campaigns, they even include some sample dungeons for practice!

72158.name: Character & Monster Assortment
72158.description:
From the back of the book:
Behold the Dungeon Master's best game supplement!

At last! A whole collection of 3D heroes and their monstrous foes is made available. From now on, easy to assemble hordes of colorful and mysterious creatures will hide behind the Dungeon Master game screen, waiting to surprise unwary players. The Character & Monster supplement brings back the best game pieces offered in your favorite D&D modules, along with a brand new series of standups.

You dungeons will never be the same without them!

- Over 120 3D game pieces
- Includes 15 double-wide game pieces for mounted knights, and large monsters like dragons, hydras, manticores, and more
- 12 male and female heroes and NPCs
- 14 brand new game pieces never yet published
- All this on seven pre-cut and scored color sheets

72159.name: Deck of Magical Items
72159.description:
From the side of the box:
Wizards, priests, and other characters who carry a small arsenal of magical items can not keep all the operator's instructions within easy reach with these useful reference cards.

The front of each card lists a magical item's game statistics and special icons that quickly identify the item's type and who can use it. On the back of the card, the item is described in detail, eliminating the need to waste precious gaming time combing through books to see how it works. When the character identifies his or her latest find from a treasure hoard, the DM can simply hand over the corresponding card, and the game goes on!

Over 400 magical items from the DUNGEON MASTER Guide and the Tome of Magic are included, plus a few cards that can be used to record specialty or or original items.

72160.name: d20 System Dice
72160.description:
From the back of the box:
Where will your path to adventure lead?
Will you board a starship and explore the galaxy?
Will you delve into the deepest dungeons in search of hidden treasure?
How will you fulfull your destiny?

Your choices -- and a little luck -- determine your fate.

Equip yourself well for your next game!

Dice usable with any d20 system game.

Contains a complete set of dice:
One 4-sided die, one 6-sided die, one 8-sided die, one 10-sided, one percentile die, one 12-sided die, and one 20-sided die.

DUNGEONS & DRAGONS
Fast-Play Adventure included!

[The included adventure is "Caves of Shadow"]

72161.name: NUTS! The Big Hurt
72161.description:
NUTS! The Big Hurt is an expansion to the NUTS! World War 2 tabletop miniatures wargame. From the publishers website:

The Hürtgen Forest was the site of America's most costly European battle of World War Two. Within its fifty square miles the US suffered more casualties than anywhere else. The Hürtgen Forest was a densely packed hell of tree-bursting artillery and machinegun fire. It was a trap where the infantrymen of the Allied First Army fool heartedly walked into. Virtually unsupported by armor and artillery, the numerically superior American forces would dash themselves against the hardened defenses of Hitler’s West Wall.

The Big Hurt is a supplement for NUTS! - 2nd Edition. Although intended to be played from the American side, The Big Hurt play's just as well from the German side. The Big Hurt can be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side or head-to-head.
Packed with 21 linked scenarios, this book covers a variety of small-unit and medium sized actions through the four months of the Hürtgen meat grinder.
Track down German infiltrators. Raid an enemy outpost. Capture a dam. It’s all up to you.

72162.name: Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition for Dummies
72162.description:
From the back of the book:
Explore the fantasy world of D&D and delve into dungeons, slay monsters, and gain treasure!

If you've been thinking of playing D&D or you've played before and you want to get up to speed on the all-new 4th Edition, this is the book for you. Here's what you need to know to join the fantasy fun.

- D&D terminology -- understand what ability check, modified, saving throw, AC, gp, hp, and XP mean

- Roll the dice -- add modifiers and see if you rolled the d20 high enough to beat the challenge

- Minding your manners -- know D&D etiquette so you'll be welcome in any adventure

- Character building -- select your character's race and class, and choose the best powers, skills, feats, and gear

- Roleplaying -- give your character a background and personality quirks

- Combat -- use combat rules, a battle grid, and miniatures to play out furious battles

72163.name: Dungeon Master 4th Edition for Dummies
72163.description:
From the back of the book:
Want to be a Dungeon Master?
Get started or ramp up your skills with this fun and easy guide!

Whether you've already run a few DUNGEONS & DRAGONS games or you've decided to try Dungeon Mastering, this book's for you. Here are all the basics of managing a game in the new 4th Edition plus everything that will take your skills to the next level: how to build a good story, design a great dungeon, craft a campaign, and so much more.

- Keep it moving -- learn to build challenging encounters, make reasonable rulings, and manage disagreements

- Play in style -- find your personal style and develop a game that plays to your strengths

- Be adventurous -- understand the parts of the adventure, how to create maps, and how to run monsters and villains

- Risk and rewards -- learn to keep the game in balance with level-appropriate rewards (experience points, treasure, and magic items)

- Campaign -- build a campaign with exciting themes, memorable villains, and plots that keep players entranced

72164.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 3, Issue 4 - May 2010)
72164.description:
In this issue:

The Plague is Coming
The Jeweled Champions
AEG News in Brief
Imperial Gift III
The Fields of Yomi (fiction)
The Empire's Glory
Mid Game Military
Win With Style
L5R RPG 4th Edition Preview

This issue of the Imperial Herald was printed in Newspaper format - far too large for a scanner! It comes folded and the images reflect this.

72165.name: Dungeon of Darkness
rpg: TSR Pick a Path to Adventure Books
72165.description:
From the back of the book:
What happens when you enter a FANTASY FOREST book? You become the hero! You must choose the path to follow. But be warned! Anything can happen!

Will you be attacked by fierce monsters?

Will you be trapped by an evil wizard's magic spell?

Or can you outsmart them all?

Turn the page and find out! Only you can decide where your adventure will lead!

When your story ends, go back to the beginning and choose a different path. Read your FANTASY FOREST book again and again for new adventures!

72166.name: Star Rangers and The Spy
rpg: TSR Pick a Path to Adventure Books
72166.description:
From the back of the book:
What happens when you enter a FANTASY FOREST book? You become the hero! You must choose the path to follow. But be warned! Anything can happen!

Will you be attacked by fierce space aliens?

Will you be trapped by a master robot's computer trickery?

Or can you outsmart them all?

Turn the page and find out! Only you can decide where your adventure will lead!

When your story ends, go back to the beginning and choose a different path. Read your FANTASY FOREST book again and agaun for new adventures!

72167.name: One Dark Night in Weeping Briar
72167.description:
From the back of the book:
Dark Deeds on a Stormy Night

A fierce nighttime storm drives you to the lonely farming community of Weeping Briar in search of shelter, but the town is suspiciously empty. A small girl holds the key to the mass disappearance, if you can rescue her from what prowls the streets and lairs beneath the town before it's too late!

This Dungeons and Dragons adventure is designed for five characters of 11th level, but contains notes on adjusting the adventure for groups of four or six characters. Specifically created for Worldwide D&D Game Day, this adventure includes a full-color poster map, encounter write-ups, monster stat blocks, enemy tactics, and even stats for new monsters to be released in the upcoming Monster Manual 2.

72168.name: Into the Shadowhaunt
72168.description:
From the publisher:
This adventure presents four linked encounters set in and below a spooky crypt known as Shadowhaunt Mausoleum.

The DM should start by reading over the adventure to familiarize himself with the text. The sections titled Adventure Background, Adventure Setup, and Adventure Summary describe what's going on and what the characters are going to be doing. The section titled Potential Ally describes an interesting twist to the plot that allows wise characters to turn a deadly enemy into a helpful ally.

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
72169.description:
From USAopoly.com:

Hello Kitty brings a sweet style to America’s favorite board game in this special Collector’s Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Enter Hello Kitty’s world as you buy, sell and trade locations in her hometown of London such as the Bakery, the Music Theatre, the School Library, Playground and more. A must-have for Hello Kitty fans of all ages.

Six collectible tokens include favorite Hello Kitty items such as her Bow, Three Apples, Milk Bottle, Lunchbox, Fish Bowl and Teddy.
72169.name: Monopoly: Hello Kitty Collector's Edition

72170.name: Monopoly: The Office Collector's Edition
72170.description:
From USAopoly.com:

Buy, sell and trade your way to victory. Visit Schrute Farms and spend a night in the cozy "closet room". Get into the scent aroma market by acquiring Serenity by Jan. If you like "cable readiness" and paper thin walls, then be sure to invest in Michael’s condo.

Make deals and trades while building your corporate empire. Stay sharp because there is only room for one at the top. . . that’s what she said.

Game comes complete with six unique collectible tokens chosen by fans featuring - Dwight bobblehead, Pam’s candy dish, Beet, Unicorn princess, World’s Best Boss coffee mug and Bacon grill.

72171.name: Monopoly: John Wayne Collector's Edition
72171.description:
From USAopoly.com:

Saddle up for an adventure with the Duke!

Celebrate the life and career of one of the most beloved actors of our time, John Wayne. Known best for his roles as a cowboy, he also was a great athlete, rancher and outdoorsman representing the adventurous spirit of America.

As you attempt to bankrupt your opponents by buying, selling and trading the most significant properties in John Wayne’s life, kindly heed these words:

"You can take everything a man has as long as you leave him his dignity." -- John Wayne

Includes six collectible tokens: Cowboy Hat, Belt Buckle, Cowboy Boot, "Duke" the dog, John Wayne’s Director's Chair and Stagecoach.

rpgitemversion: Juega Más y Mejor: Accesorio gratuito de actualización a D&D v.3.5
72172.name: Play More: Free D&D v.3.5 Accessory Update
72172.description:
From Publishers website:

The purpose of this booklet is not to provide a comprehensive list of everything that has changed with the 3.5 revision. The changes are too large in number and varied in scope to be able to provide an all-inclusive inventory. Instead, what we want to do is to show you a broad picture of what has changed and to provide you with support for updating our most popular product.

Do you need to make these changes? No.

This booklet is for players and Dungeon Master who value rules precision and need to know what's changed so that they can continue to enjoy their 3rd Edition producs.

You might choose to make notations in your existing books, photocopy and cut up this booklet to add bookmarklike inserts to your books, or simply use this booklet simultaneously with your books.

We provide a brief general overview of the core books and detailed revision nots for Deities and Demigods, Epic Level Handbook, Fiend Folio, Manual of the Planes, and Monster Manual II.

72173.name: Monopoly: Major League Baseball Collector's Edition
72173.description:
From USAopoly.com:

Batter up!

What fan hasn’t dreamed of owning and running a Major League Baseball team? Now you can buy, sell and trade all 30 American League and National League teams in a quest to own them all. Major League Baseball and the MONOPOLY game have teamed up to put an exciting new spin on America’s favorite board game. Put on your game face and get ready to wheel and deal!
Includes six collectible tokens: Batter, Catcher’s Mask, Ball in Glove, Hot Dog, Pitcher and World Series Trophy.

72175.name: Crystal Formation
72175.description:
Crystal Formation is an Icehouse game for 2-4 players played on a chessboard.
Each player is given all of one color pieces and starts with a tree of their color in their corner of the board.The piece represents a node.
During your turn,you may perform one of the following actions:
1.Place new nodes.
2.Increase the total power of a node.
3.Move a node.
First player with 5 trees on the board wins.

72176.name: Ice 3
72176.description:
Ice 3 is an Icehouse game played on a chessboard.
Dump the Icehouse pieces out and arrange them as randomly on a chessboard as you can.Leave the center four spaces empty.
During your turn,you may move all pieces of either a color or a size any number of spaces in any one direction.
The object of the game is to get all of one color in any corner.

72177.name: Am laufenden Band
72177.description: Based on the popular German TV series "Am laufenden Band", the boardgame version is fun for all in the family. Every player maneuvers his playing piece across a conveyor belt, aiming for the highest scoring playing fields. The players push their luck and have to jump off the conveyor belt at right time. Content: 1 playing board, 24 playing pieces, 1 dice, 1 rulebook.

72179.name: Deadly Trappings
72179.description:
From the Back Cover:

Over seventy-five deadly traps lurk between these covers!


Tired of the players just waltzing through your dungeons?
Bored with the same old traps?
Need new challenges to spice up your campaign?
What's a GameMaster to do?


Bring back that sense of excitement and wonder... and more than a little bit of fear... with Deadly Trappings!

Deadly Trappings includes over 75 twisted traps easily adaptable to a variety of campaign settings and levels of difficulty, all thoroughly researched and finely detailed, with: purpose of design, mechanisms used, lethality, suggested damage and/or damage substitution rules, intended outcome, ideas for variant traps, and a wealth of additional information. Furthermore, explanatory illustrations throughout (featuring Joe the Fighter) provide an awesome visual representation to both players and GameMasters.

Whether you're a new GameMaster facing seasoned players who think they've seen it all, or an experienced GM looking to perk up the game, Deadly Trappings is an essential resource for your arsenal!

72180.name: Counter Collection 7: Undead
72180.description:
From the publisher:

Counter Collection 7: Undead has over 200 full-color counters for undead creatures for D&D 3.5 packed in a handy metal coffin. Includes a full-color, 16-page book with stats for eight brand-new undead creatures to surprise your players.

This spooky Counter Collection product contains counters for hundreds of undead monsters and their minions - including nearly 100 new creatures introduced only in this collection! In full color, these counters are sure to add an unhealthy dose of frightening thrill and chill to any tabletop game.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2010 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
72181.description:
Gackerei ums Hühnerei is a easy fun game for children. Players are sitting on 5 "egg" cards, which are placed top down on their chair. A dice is rolled and shows if a red, yellow or blue biddy should be hatched. Simutaniously all players uncover their eggs to find the right biddy and place it in the nest.
The fastest player gets his egg as a VP and takes abother egg to place on it his chair.
But there can also be a fox around. So be aware...

Die Spieler legen jeweils fünf Eier-Karten verdeckt auf ihren Stuhl, setzen sich drauf und brüten! Der Würfel zeigt an, ob ein rotes, gelbes oder blaues Küken ausgebrütet werden soll. Jetzt ist Reaktion gefragt! Die Kinder schauen schnell nacheinander unter ihre Eier, ob sich ein solches Küken dort verbirgt. Hat ein Spieler ein passendes Küken gefunden, legt er es rasch ins Nest auf den Tisch, hält seine Hand darüber und gackert laut. Aber aufgepasst! Deckt ein Spieler einen Fuchs auf und legt ihn ins Nest, dann ruft er laut: Vorsicht, Fuchs! Alle Spieler müssen möglichst schnell ihre Hand auf das Nest legen. Wer am langsamsten ist, muss ein Ei abgeben.
[www.kosmos.de]
72181.name: Gackerei ums Hühnerei

72184.name: Counter Collection 4: World of the Diamond Throne
72184.description:
From the back cover:

From litorians, verrik, faen, mojh, giants and sibeccai to greenbonds, totem warriors, akashics, magisters, warmains and more, this counter collections covers the exciting and diverse races and classes introduced in Monte Cook's Arcana Unearthed.

Also features new monsters and counters designed for use with The Diamond Throne setting (including Alabasts, Shadow Trolls, Rhodin and more), and the adventures Plague of Dreams and Siege on Ebonring Keep.

With more than 575 counters, this collection contains everything needed to explore the World of the Diamond Throne.

72185.name: Counter Collection 5: Summoned Creatures
72185.description:
From the publisher:

Summoned Creatures includes all the SRD monsters for the Summon Monster and Summon Nature's Ally spells. This is a perfect aid for both the GM and player - print as many counters as you need to summon your favorite monster to adorn the gaming table.

72186.name: Counter Collection: Perilous Heights
72186.description:
From the publisher:

Straight from the pages of Monster Geographica: Hill & Mountain by Expeditious Retreat Press comes this product, with scores and scores of creatures appropriate to a journey into the mountains and surrounding foothills! Keep your group on their toes (or climbing pitons), and arrange for a surprise they never expected.

This gaming accessory contains counters for hundreds of monsters and beasts, whether winged, hoofed, or clawed — including artwork for every single monster contained within the Monster Geographica: Hill & Mountain book! Rendered in full color, these counters are sure to make a welcome visual gameplay addition to any tabletop roleplaying game: the perfect supplement (or alternative!) to miniatures.

72187.name: Counter Collection: Ancient Darkness
72187.description:
From the publisher:

This gaming accessory contains counters for hundreds of dungeon-based monsters and their minions - artwork for every single monster contained within the Monster Geographica: Underground book - that's 200 unique images! In full-color these counters are sure to make a fresh visual gameplay addition to any tabletop game.

72188.name: Counter Collection: Untamed Woodlands
72188.description:
From the publisher:

This gaming accessory contains counters for hundreds of forest-based monsters and their minions - artwork for every single monster contained within the Monster Geographica: Forest book - that's 200 unique images! In full-color these counters are sure to make a fresh visual gameplay addition to any tabletop game.

72189.name: Counter Collection: Murky Depths & Slimy Shores
72189.description:
From the publisher:

This gaming accessory contains counters for hundreds of water-based monsters and their minions – artwork for every single monster contained within the Monster Geographica: Marsh & Aquatic book - that's 201 unique images! In full-color these counters are sure to make a fresh visual gameplay addition to any tabletop game.

72190.name: Counter Pack 1: Demons & Devils
72190.description:
From the Introduction:

This Counter Pack, focusing on Demons and Devils, contains more than 65 unique monster images, most with multiple counters available for use. These full-color counters are based on a one-inch equals five-foot scale. Therefore, creatures with a 5-ft. by 5-ft. Face statistic will occupy a single one-inch counter. Before beginning play, carefully cut apart the counters with an x-acto knife or scissors. Please be sure to take care with these tools.

There are eight pages of counters in total. These pages are divided into 4 categories: Demons from the Core d20 rules, Demons from Book of Fiends, Volume Two: Armies of the Abyss, Devils from the Core d20 rules, and Devils from Book of Fiends, Volume One: Legions of Hell. Each page lists the type, name, Challenge Rating, and the number of counters for each creature. For monsters that appear in quantity, we have often provided alternate images, to provide some variety and enhance the gaming experience.

72191.name: Escape From Sneakius IV
72191.description:
Introduction

You drew the short straw on Space Ranger duty today - your Federation of Planets scout ship was assigned to Sneakius IV, the most dangerous planet in the entire universe. And in keeping with your luck, your ship encountered a mysterious space storm and crashed!

Sneakius IV is crammed full of every kind of lethal predator and deadly parasite that you could imagine... and you'll have to use your imagination because no survey team has ever survived the onslaught of ravenous beasties to file a report. Your only hope is to try to make it across unknown terrain past horrible monsters to an escape shuttle at the abandoned ecology survey station. But if you're caught on the way, you'll end up as lunch. So, tread carefully Space Ranger... and pray you don't taste too delicious.

Gameplay Abstract

Players take on the role of characters moving from a crash site location to an abandoned ecology station using point to point movement. The first player to reach the ecology station is the winner. As players move their pawns through locations, they must roll a die to avoid detection by alien monsters represented by tokens. If detected, they must fight. Individual players use characters with individual strengths and weaknesses and player powers, helping them avoid or defeat monsters. Each round, events on cards cause more monsters to spawn and regulate monster movement around the game board.

Additional Information

This game is an entry to the contest Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest.

72192.name: Counter Pack 2: Tribes, Clans & Cults
72192.description:
From the back cover:

This Counter Pack, focusing on groups, contains more than 300 counters for use with any tabletop fantasy roleplaying game! From the orcish might of Mogor's Fist to the cruel devotion of the Cult of Bakaal, your players will be able to see what they're up against in full color.

This Counter Pack includes images for:

Mogor's Fist, a powerful orc strike force
Cult of Bakaal, a group of evil demon-worshippers
Pax Hobgoblinica, a powerful hobgoblin military force
Bertram's Guild, a seedy urban organization
Knights of Solorien, a shining example of bravery and justice
The Vampire's Legion, the living dead searching for victims
The Prince's Worgriders, various shades of goblin power
The Jirockk Clan, fire giants with an attitude
Residents of the Mattadin, the inhabitants of a fey valley




This Counter Pack features every counter necessary for use with the 72-page Fiery Dragon adventure Beyond All Reason.

Includes new group feats by Mark Clover of Creative Mountain Games!

72193.name: Counter Pack 3: Denizens of Dungeons & Darkness
72193.description:
From the back cover:

Over 150 counters featuring important monsters and characters from the Rappan Athuk dungeon-crawl series by Necromancer Games as well as Queen of Lies (OGL 3.5) by Fiery Dragon Productions.

72194.name: Counter Pack: Dragons
72194.description:
From the back cover:

The most notorious of all fantasy creatures now has its own Counter Pack! Featuring all of the core dragon breeds, ranging in sizes from Tiny to Gargantuan, these counters will instill dread and respect in your players! Includes 4 new full-bodied
dragon counters, and complete stats for the Psionic Drake! PLUS: Dragon-kin and dragon-themed creatures, to act as servants or worshipers of the powerful dragons, and provide a interesting variety of encounter possibilities.

72195.name: Warlords of the Accordlands: The World Atlas
rpghonor: 2007 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Nominee
2007 ENnie for Best d20/d20 OGL Product - Nominee
72195.description:
[ From the back of the book ]


An Ancient Accord is Broken...

Centuries ago, the races of Larnisar banded together to defeat their creator, the Great Dragon, who sought to unmake his creation in a furious, continent-spanning storm of bitter destruction. Victorious, or so they thought, the races of the Accord grew soft and fell back into their familiar ways, political strife and territorial conquests sweeping across the land.

Today, the Accordlands is home to lurking mystery and wonders beyond time. In the Deverenian Empire, dark nobles conspire to bring all under their tyrannical rule, enforcing worship of the very soul of the Great Dragon: the Storm. In the haunted forests, the necromantic Elves are doomed to tragically short lives, all too soon drifting away as dust in the wind. Baraxton is home to what was once a thriving human community, bit its mercenaries now fall victim to the oppressive weight of Northog military might.

Welcome to the Accordlands, where heroes are short-lived and in short supply.


Encyclopedic information about the Accordlands' major races and nations.
Mapped locations for each of the Accordlands' most prominent cities.
An overview of the Accordlands' deities and religions (and their secrets).
Detailed accounts of the Accordlands during the First War with the Dragon.
Backgrounds on many of the Accordlands' most influential citizens.
The mysteries of the various planes of existence, and the prizes and pitfalls that await.

72196.name: The Society of Dreamers
72196.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Europe, in the early 19th century, a little-known group was formed. The members called themselves the Society of Dreamers. The Society believed that there were autonomous life forms living in people’s dreams. They called these creatures mnemosites. In this game, you and your friends play the Society of Dreamers, seeking to uncover the nature of the mnemosites with tools of science and mysticism. You will witness the childhood and youth of the members; the forming of the Society; and their investigation and - possibly - understanding of the mnemosite phenomenon. The game is written for 2-5 players and takes an evening to play. There’s no game master, and no need to prepare anything (beyond reading the rules).

72197.description:
In the not so distant future, mankind has managed to lay waste to earth's surface. Even though forced to find a new home on the ocean ground, nothing stopped humans to continue battling each other.
You are a mercenary trying to make his living by serving those that pay most.
Your mission sounds easy at first glance:
Scout the ocean ground for three different resources and bring them back to the hangar, so the technicans can build a bomb you are to drop over the enemy base.
Here comes the downside: You are all on your own between the beasts of the deep sea as well as the very well armed hostile submarines.
And the resources to equip your sub are limited!
Good luck, mercenary - we count on you.

Schleichfahrt - sneaking behind enemy lines has been created during the Sneaky Sci Fi Game Contest in May/June 2010 held by Rudolf Aligierski.
It is a solitaire ocean crawl in which you are playing a mercenary in his sub on his mission to gather resources and - upon having done so - to deploy a bomb on the hostile base.
While you will encounter monsters of the deep sea as well as loads of hostile subs, fighting is not always an option. Most of the time you will be better off relying on your engines to maneuver you out of sight of the enemy subs.
72197.name: Schleichfahrt: Sneaking Behind Enemy Lines
boardgamepodcastepisode: 109 - Schleichfahrt: Sneaking Behind Enemy Lines

"Anemone Mine"
